content.description:
If Third-Party Voters Were Forced to Choose Between the Two Major-Party Candidates in the 2016 Election

Source: NBC News and Survey Monkey poll, 2016

(L) - Libertarian

(G) - Green
content.question: Based on the data in the bar graph and your knowledge of presidential elections, how should Hillary Clinton's campaign have responded if Jill Stein’s support in the polls had increased significantly as Election Day approached?

choices.label: By attempting to draw sharp contrasts between Clinton and Stein on issues important to voters
By increasing its focus on winning voters in states where Trump was ahead by large margins
By adopting positions on issues similar to Stein’s in an attempt to win over those voters before the election
By positioning itself ideologically as somewhere between Trump and Johnson

content.answer: By adopting positions on issues similar to Stein’s in an attempt to win over those voters before the election

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
